content.question: The figure represents the wave fronts for a wave traveling perpendicular to the end of a barrier. Which of the following best represents the waves as they travel past the barrier?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of a wave moving towards and past a barrier. The direction of the wave’s motion before it hits the barrier is represented by a vertical arrow that points upward, and is below and perpendicular to the barrier. There are horizontal lines below the barrier that represent wave fronts, which are parallel to each other and to the barrier, and extend to the right farther than the end of the barrier. Shorter horizontal, parallel wave fronts continue past the right side of the barrier, with a vertical arrow that points upward to show their direction of motion.  There are no lines in the region behind the barrier.
